item.title: Best Video Game Auteurs
item.description:
Summary

  • Auteurs bring distinct, personal design to games, preventing AAA from playing it safe.
  • Auteur-driven titles (Kojima, Miyazaki, Levine) craft memorable, risky experiences fans love.
  • Indies like Jonathan Blow and Daniel Mullins prove auteur vision can reshape genres.

Video game auteurs should be celebrated, especially in the realm of AAA gaming, where many titles play things too safe. This is why these figures are important to ensure that gaming doesn't get too stale, and to help players rediscover the magic that got them into this hobby in the first place.

These auteurs are people with a distinct approach to game design that is unique, palpable, and unrestricted by outside influences, so that they end up injecting a unique personality into the games they direct. Some of the most notable video game auteurs in the industry have crafted memorable experiences that fans love to this day. Their impact on the world of gaming is undeniable and has turned them into legends of the industry.

Ken Levine

Created An Iconic FPS Franchise With BioShock

After working on System Shock 2 and learning a ton from this title's development, Ken Levine went into business for himself, directing one of the most iconic FPS games in the form of BioShock . He wasn't present for the sequel's development, but returned with a bang in a major way with the trilogy's final game.

BioShock Infinite is another great FPS that fans loved, even if some people have turned on it over time. However, that takes nothing away from Levine's legacy. Now, fans are hoping that this developer will make a successful comeback with the release of his upcoming sci-fi FPS Judas .

Hideo Kojima

The Quintessential Video Game Auteur

Kojima is everyone's favorite video game auteur, as he has crafted some of the oddest and most engaging video games of all time. His work on the Metal Gear series speaks volumes. It's a shame that his relationship with Konami broke down to the point where he was unceremoniously booted from the company.

However, this falling out led to Sony snapping up this in-demand personality. From there, Kojima's work on Death Stranding has made it clear why people want more weirdness in the AAA space. Both the original game and its sequel are a blast to play, and fans can only hope that Sony and Kojima's relationship continues to bear fruit.

Jonathan Blow

Braid Was One Of The First Indie Games To Break New Ground

The indie space may be massive now, but it was still in its infancy when Jonathan Blow released Braid . This imaginative platformer featured a time rewind mechanic and lets players control what they assume to be a hero, only for the finale to blow their minds.

True to his name, Jonathan blew everyone's mind with this ingenious title and showed everyone what indie games were capable of. He continued his excellent run with The Witness , one of the most immersive puzzle games ever made, which fans love dearly to this day.

Tim Schafer

Created Psychonauts And Brutal Legend

Tim Schafer is a notable industry veteran who made waves with his work on Psychonauts , one of the greatest platformers ever made. He continued this trend of excellence with Brutal Legend , an action game that wears its love for heavy metal on its sleeve.

Unfortunately, despite its quality, the latter game tanked, and it seemed that Schafer's days in the video game industry were numbered. However, the rise of indie gaming allowed him to develop Broken Age, a fun point-and-click adventure with a ton of heart. With the release of Psychonauts 2 , it's clear that this auteur isn't going anywhere.

Hidetaka Miyazaki

Made FromSoftware One Of The Biggest Gaming Companies Around

Miyazaki burst onto the scene with his work on Dark Souls , a game that displayed this auteur's love for hardcore gameplay and mysterious stories. His fanbase grew in no time, and his relationship with FromSoftware spawned several other games that fans adore.

From Bloodborne to Elden Ring , Miyazaki has wowed the masses with his work on these titles. His brand of storytelling is unique and does a great job of elevating these titles, which makes it clear why Dark Souls 2 didn't attain the same level of critical acclaim since Miyazaki wasn't a part of its development.

Yoko Taro

Finally Enjoyed The Success He Always Deserved With NieR: Automata

Yoko Taro was a major player in the video game industry for a very long time, but it took a while for him to attain the fame he deserved. The Drakengard games had great narratives, but their gameplay held them back.

By partnering with PlatinumGames, this auteur could finally eliminate this one major drawback holding his games back, and the launch of Nier: Automata personified this in spades. This title was a massive hit and propelled Yoko Taro's unique brand of storytelling to the stratosphere, turning him into one of the most celebrated video game personalities of all time.

Daniel Mullins

Inscryption Introduced Many People To This Indie Creator's Brilliant Mind

Most people became aware of Daniel Mullins after his work on Inscryption . This amazing roguelike deckbuilder is in a class of its own and uses its horror atmosphere to tell a scintillating meta story that ties into his other games.

Both Pony Island and The Hex are great games that fans of Inscryption will also love. This developer's unique horror focus shines in these titles and makes it clear why his games have tickled the fancy of many indie game fans.

Warren Spector

The Godfather Of Immersive Sim Gaming

Warren Spector is the auteur everyone should thank for his work on iconic immersive sims like Thief: The Dark Project and Deus Ex . His direction was integral to helping these games become the progenitor for a genre that fans love (even if the sales figures for these titles are all over the place).

Both games have undeniable legacies, with players still making mods for the first Thief game that have become notable in their own right. Meanwhile, the legend of Deus Ex speaks for itself, and it's a shame that the franchise's future under Embracer Group is very shaky.

item.title: Coolest Features Confirmed For Ananta
item.description:
Free-to-play games are becoming increasingly common on consoles, thanks in part to the success of games like Genshin Impact . Many free-to-play games that have followed it are hard to distinguish from Genshin Impact in terms of visuals and gameplay styles. If something works, there may as well be copies of it.

It can be hard to pay attention to all of these games, but Ananta should be on everyone’s radar. It’s one of the few free-to-play games that looks like it is trying to do something different while still keeping that Genshin Impact visual aesthetic. Can this satiate fans of games like Marvel’s Spider-Man and Grand Theft Auto 6 ? These exciting confirmed features suggest Ananta may have something special for fans experience.

The Playable Characters

Switching In Real Time

The main character of Ananta seems to be Chenxiu, a captain in the police department. He’s at least the character that trailers have focused on the most. The latest trailer demonstrated that players can switch between characters, but with a unique twist. Instead of switching between them in the same place, characters will be out in the world doing their own thing, just like in Grand Theft Auto 5 or Marvel's Spider-Man 2 .

There was one example where the player switched between one character and another who was driving a car miles away. There was another where the player was fighting enemies and then switched to another character close by who was ready with sniper support. Tactically, switching between characters sounds like a fun mechanic, but it’s not known how exactly this will work. Also, characters can be dressed up in fresh cosmetics, which is good to know.

Swinging Around

Venom Is Here

Chenxiu has some sort of symbiotic powers, like Venom from the Spider-Man universe, that let him swing around the city. It’s not known whether other characters can use this ability as well or where exactly it comes from. It could be a gadget, or characters like Chenxiu could be possessed by alien lifeforms.

Either way, it’s cool to see swinging abilities in a game not called Spider-Man . This ability can also be used in battle, as there is a point in the latest trailer wherein Chenxiu hooks onto an enemy with this ability. There seems to be glide suits as well, but this was shown in a shot of a group of characters using them, so this may not actually be an additional traversal method.

The Combat

From Brawling To Shooting

Combat in Ananta looks nice and varied for an action game. There are a number of scenes where characters are pummeling and grappling enemies with their fists. Weapons will also be available, from giant hammers to weirder things like tennis rackets. There’s a truly wild shot of an enemy getting launched with a golf club as if he were a golf ball.

This could be a mini-game, or golf clubs could just be overpowered in Ananta . Then there were several gun-like weapons, like rifles and rocket launchers. There is a weapon wheel in the game, but it’s unclear whether each weapon shown in the trailer can be equipped or simply picked up as a disposable weapon akin to the Yakuza games.

The Vehicle Support

From Boats To Helicopters

Who needs vehicles when Spider-Man-like powers are on the table? Well, in case fans do want to use the swinging mechanics, there are four distinct vehicle types in the latest trailer. There are several cars, from sports cars to police cars. There was one scene with characters driving a boat, and another with a helicopter. Finally, a character can be seen hitting a jump with his motorcycle and rocketing into the sky.

There are no moments wherein characters are seen stealing cars like in Grand Theft Auto , so it’s not known whether players can simply take cars or if they need to be earned or purchased. Since it seems like players are part of a police force, they may be able to commandeer vehicles using their badge, like in L.A. Noire . Either way, fans of open-world games set in large cities will have plenty of ways to get around.

Stealth Gameplay

And Controlling Gadgets

Aside from the action, there are a few stealthy approaches to situations shown in the latest trailer as well. Players can enter vents and sneak around. They can crouch on the ground, too, and hide behind cover. Chenxiu’s tentacle-like ability can get him access to higher vantage points to observe from above or sneak around inside buildings.

Players will have access to a phone that can do a myriad of things. Controlling a spider-like drone, for example, will be a good way to observe enemies during a stealthy approach to a mission. There’s even a segment in the latest trailer that showcases players using the phone's camera to take selfies. That’s not a stealthy mechanic, but it seems like Ananta may have open-ended gameplay when it comes to missions.

The Mini-Games

Filling Out The World

Finally, what would an open-world game be without mini-games? There’s one scene of a character hitting a baseball with a dog next to them. The dog does nothing, but perhaps this is tied to some fetching mechanic. There’s a more direct scene with characters playing street basketball outside.

One of the more hilarious mini-game examples has two characters facing off in a slap battle. Believe it or not, this is a real sport covered by channels and promoted heavily by a company called Power Slap. Slapping aside, it seems like attending concerts will be a side activity too, as there are several shown in the latest trailer. This was just a taste of the day and nightlife players can find in Ananta , and there will assuredly be more to come.

Ananta

item.title: Fortnite Teases KPop Demon Hunters Collab
item.description:
Fortnite is officially starting to tease the rumored collaboration with K-Pop Demon Hunters , interacting with one of the popular series' voice actors on social media. The beloved battle royale is gearing up for what could be one of its biggest events of the year next month, preparing to officially kick off the Halloween season with "Fortnitemares." Rumors have suggested that Fortnite 's Halloween event this year is going to be a sizable event, said to be significantly bigger than last year's iteration. Now, one of the most exciting rumored collaborations is getting officially teased.

One of Fortnite 's biggest upcoming crossovers is expected to see one of the year's breakout hit movies make the jump to the battle royale. K-Pop Demon Hunters debuted on Netflix in June to critical and fan acclaim, quickly becoming one of the biggest new releases of 2025 and reportedly the most-watched animated film on Netflix. The film saw such standout success that Netflix has already started to work with Sony on a potential sequel to K-Pop Demon Hunters . K-Pop Demon Hunters now looks to be making its way into Fortnite soon.

Fortnite has officially begun to tease its upcoming K-Pop Demon Hunters crossover through the TikTok account of one of the series' main actors. The official TikTok account for the battle royale has so far left two comments on videos posted by voice actor Rei Ami, who plays the role of Zoey in K-Pop Demon Hunters . The comments clearly catch Ami by surprise, posting follow-up videos featuring the comments and expressing her excitement about her character coming to Fortnite . Epic Games has yet to officially announce the K-Pop Demon Hunters collaboration, though it is expected to be a major part of the Fortnitemares event.

Fortnite Teases Upcoming K-Pop Demon Hunters Collab

Fortnite 's cryptic new TikTok comments should all but confirm the recent rumors about the upcoming K-Pop Demon Hunters collaboration. New rumors and leaks from the game have already begun to hint at some of the content coming with the crossover, including new skins for each member of K-Pop Demon Hunters ' main trio. Prominent leaker HYPEX has also suggested that Fortnite 's K-Pop Demon Hunters collab will be "stacked" with a plethora of content for players to experience beyond the skins.

The rumors surrounding Fortnite 's Halloween event have continued to swirl with a plethora of exciting new crossovers said to be on the way. Everything from Scooby-Doo to Friday the 13th has been rumored to appear during this year's Fortnitemares, with K-Pop Demon Hunters expected to serve as a highlight of the event. Fortnite also recently launched the battle royale's big collaboration with popular musical act Daft Punk, with "The Daft Punk Experience" featuring 31 different songs from the group. Fortnite fans should have lots to look forward to from the game throughout the rest of 2025.

295
8.9 /10

Fortnite

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero Confirms Version 2.3 Special Program Date and Time
item.description:
Zenless Zone Zero has officially confirmed the date and time for the game's upcoming Version 2.3 Special Program broadcast, set to reveal everything coming with the next patch. The HoYoverse urban action RPG has given fans plenty to be excited about throughout its recent updates, with lots of notable characters and events. Version 2.2 brought the highly-anticipated releases of both Seed and Orphie as two new members of OBOL Squad, alongside a pair of bosses with The Defiler and The Defector. Now, Zenless Zone Zero is getting fans ready for its next patch.

HoYoverse has already given fans some early teasers about Version 2.3 ahead of the update's official reveals, with multiple new characters on the way. Zenless Zone Zero has already revealed three brand-new characters set to join the RPG's roster during the Version 2.3 update, with each coming from the game's "Spook Shack" faction. Yidhari and Lucia are both expected to join the game as the update's featured S-Rank units, while Komano Manato is rumored to be joining as an A-Rank character. HoYoverse has now revealed fans won't have to wait much longer to learn more about Version 2.3.

HoYoverse officially announced Zenless Zone Zero 's newest Special Program on Friday, set to unveil all the details about Version 2.3. Zenless Zone Zero will officially air its Version 2.3 Special Program on September 29, with the broadcast set to begin at 7:30 A.M. EDT. The Special Program will reveal more details about the gameplay of Zenless Zone Zero 's three new characters, as well as introduce the new story content and events coming with the patch. Zenless Zone Zero is also expected to give out some brand-new distribution codes, rewarding fans with 300 Polychromes for a limited time.

Zenless Zone Zero Announces Version 2.3 Special Program

  • September 29, 7:30 A.M. EDT

Zenless Zone Zero 's next update should bring plenty to the table to satisfy fans of the HoYoverse urban action RPG. Previous leaks have suggested that a pair of popular Electric characters will be making a return on the update's limited gacha banners, with re-runs of Harumasa and Soldier 0 Anby said to run during the patch. Rumors have also heavily suggested that popular Version 1.7 S-Rank character Vivian may receive a new skin as part of the update. Version 2.3 is expected to launch on October 15.

HoYoverse's newest update looks to put the spotlight on one of the game's most beloved factions once again, with Spook Shack returning to the gacha banner. Version 2.1 welcomed the first members of the group with the release of Yuzuha and Alice alongside Zenless Zone Zero 's summer event. Both Spook Shack characters made a big splash with their release to the game as well, with Yuzuha considered one of Zenless Zone Zero 's strongest support units. Zenless Zone Zero 's newest update looks to have lots of exciting content in store for fans coming soon.

36
8.3 /10

item.title: Best Liminal Space Horror Games
item.description:
Liminal space horror is all about feeling unease, like walking down a fluorescent-lit hallway after midnight or standing alone in an empty playground. Horror games have long understood the power of the almost-familiar: the way an abandoned mall, a vacant hotel, or an endless office can become a stage for the mind’s most persistent anxieties.

The following titles feature liminal spaces, making them the focus of their terror, transforming bland thresholds and overlooked corners into existential nightmares. These examples are some of the best liminal space horror games that trap players in the uncanny valley between worlds.

Anatomy

This House Is Far From Ordinary

Anatomy
Psychological
Horror
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
2016

Powered by

Created by Kitty Horrorshow, Anatomy is a short but unnerving experience that invites players to explore a deserted, utterly generic suburban house. The twist is that the home itself is the monster. Each room is packed with cassette tapes explaining the "anatomy" of a dwelling, as if the building is a living organism. The more that players listen, the more the house warps, room by room.

Anatomy excels by focusing on the places between places - closets, stairwells, kitchens, etc. The horror is subtle, psychological, and cumulative. No jump scares, no monsters. Just a place...and the dawning suspicion that players may have outstayed their welcome.

Anemoiapolis: Chapter 1

A Deceptively Horrific Experience

Anemoiapolis
Horror
First-Person
Exploration
Systems
Released
May 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

The first thing players will notice in Anemoiapolis is the oppressive silence: miles of vacant locker rooms, public pools, and the echo of footsteps. Navigation is purposely disorienting. Fans may think they’re looping, but subtle changes twist every attempt at mapping the place. This title essentially plays on the childhood fear of being left behind after hours, compounding it with a heavy dose of dream logic.

There are fleeting moments of relief, but they only underline the uncanniness. Players won't be able to shake the feeling that something is fundamentally wrong with the location, which is essential for a great liminal space horror game.

Lost In Vivo

A Nightmare Beneath The Streets

Lost in Vivo
Psychological
Horror
Systems
Released
October 5, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Lost in Vivo doesn’t hide its inspirations. Silent Hill ’s DNA runs through pretty much every sewer and service tunnel. KIRA’s indie darling finds its own voice in the unending sprawl beneath the city streets. Fans play an unnamed protagonist whose support dog is swept away in a storm, which prompts a descent into an endless, ever-shifting labyrinth of pipes, subways, and derelict infrastructure. Lost in Vivo leans heavily into claustrophobia and is very effective at it as a result.

Everyday locations take on an unspoken oppressiveness. Not to mention that the sound design is brutally effective, layering industrial hums with distant echoes until the world above feels as unreal as the nightmares below. Lost in Vivo is a fever dream, and it leaves players questioning whether they’re searching for the dog...or themselves.

POOLS

Those With Aquaphobia Need Not Apply

Pools
Simulation
Horror
Exploration
Systems
Released
April 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

POOLS isn't recommended for those with a fear of water. Players will find themselves alone in a gigantic, maze-like aquatic facility with no clear goal. There are no traditional objectives, and there are definitely no lifeguards. At first, the experience may seem calming. But the further players go, the more the architecture starts to rebel.

Some hallways lead nowhere while others warp in ways that defy geometry. Despite the lack of a visible threat, POOLS creates a persistent feeling of being hunted, as if something just beyond one's peripheral vision is tracking every move.

Escape The Backrooms

The Strange Internet Legend Comes Alive

Escape The Backrooms
Horror
Systems
Released
August 11, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Escape the Backrooms is all about yellow-carpeted halls buzzing with dead light and low-grade static. The game doesn’t bother with narrative. Rather, the only goal is to escape, only that every exit leads to another layer of escalation. Escape the Backrooms nails the aesthetic it's going for with its stained walls and the sense of an office building repurposed for no one and nothing.

The suggestion underlying it all is that fans may not actually be alone, and the things hunting them are equally at home in their surroundings. It’s a test of endurance because each level piles on new iterations of spatial unease. It turns internet folklore into a slow-motion panic attack.

The Backrooms 1998

VHS Horror At Its Finest

The Backrooms 1998
Horror
Survival
Action
Simulation
Systems
Released
February 20, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Where Escape the Backrooms is clinical, The Backrooms 1998 is deeply personal. Filtered through VHS static, the game drops players into a childhood memory gone horribly wrong. There’s a plot, delivered through found footage and voiceovers. However, the real terror is in the environment itself, which features no shortage of bloodstained yellow wallpaper and an enemy that can pick up on the user's microphone.

The Backrooms 1998 understands very well that liminality is often linked to a person's memories. The monsters are less important than the sensation of becoming trapped in a looping recollection. As such, the effect is unnerving and sad at the same time.

The Exit 8

The Endless Subway

The Exit 8
Puzzle
Simulation
Adventure
Systems
Released
November 29, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

In The Exit 8 , players are stuck in a never-ending Japanese subway tunnel and are tasked with spotting anomalies while making their way toward the titular exit. There are no monsters or cheap scares. Instead, it's the creeping suspicion that something is off. Subtlety is at the forefront: walls that shift, posters that change, and lights that flicker on a delay.

A lot of the uneasiness stems from the slow realization that escape may not be possible, which is gold when it comes to horror game design. By stripping everything down to its essentials, it lets the players' own anxieties do most of the work.

No Players Online

Abandoned Games Are Scarier Than You Think

  • Platform(s) : PC
  • Released : 2019
  • Developer(s) : Adam Pype, Viktor Kraus, Ward D'Heer
  • Genre(s) : Horror

Set in a defunct multiplayer shooter server, fans wander empty maps meant for a dozen players, surrounded by the forgotten artifacts of online play (like bullet holes, capture points, and echoing announcer voices).

The tension in No Players Online lies in the unsettling emptiness of digital nostalgia. Glitches and spectral figures begin to intrude. It encapsulates the melancholy of a dead server, turning every pixelated corridor into a mausoleum for long-forgotten fun. The experience is short, but lingers long after fans log off.

The Complex: Found Footage

Beware "The Complex"

The Complex: Found Footage
Horror
Multiplayer
Systems
Released
August 18, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

The entire experience in The Complex: Found Footage is presented through the eyes of a camcorder-wielding protagonist. The "Complex" in question is a monstrous, concrete underworld of office spaces, maintenance tunnels, and liminal commercial zones all rendered with a sterile, haunted-urban feel.

The scares are subtle, mostly environmental, with the occasional hint of something inhuman lurking in the shadows, and the psychological toll is unmistakable. By the end, players will feel as if they’ve actually survived a nightmarish expedition. For fans of the Backrooms mythos or analog horror in general, The Complex: Found Footage perfectly captures the genre’s blend of banality and terror.
